image.altText: Slices of body parts covered in Perspex and put on display on walls.

props.synopsis: The Tasmanian Coroner's Office is investigating whether body parts from coronial autopsies have been collected and held in a university museum without the knowledge of consent of families. The office has now published the names of more than 120 people who may have been affected.

title.children: Names of people whose body parts may have been kept without consent released

image.altText: A sign sits outside Launceston General Hospital.

props.synopsis: Patients in some Launceston General Hospital wards have had to use wet face washers and take off blankets to try to stay cool due to a lack of air conditioning, a family member says.

title.children: 'Extremely uncomfortable': Patients in 'aging hospital' swelter without air con

image.altText: a wooden piece of furniture

props.synopsis: Helen Watson made a telephone table in 1972 as a schoolgirl. She dreamt of being a cabinet-maker at a time women weren't accepted in the trade. Her table recently turned up at the Hobart tip.

title.children: 'Amazing': Tip shop worker reunited with table 52 years after making it

image.altText: Two photographs, a young white girl dressed as a fairy and a white woman on a stage with a green and yellow scarf

props.synopsis: Motivation speaker, voice artist, wish granter and breast cancer ambassador Robyn Moore reflects on how she became who she is today.

title.children: From rural Tassie kid to voice of Blinky Bill: Robyn Moore writes a letter to her younger self

image.altText: A street view of a single-storey brick house next to a two-storey block of flats.

props.synopsis: More than two decades ago, the Tasmanian government sold a block of flats in a rural town. It turns out, it also "erroneously" transferred a house next door that a Sydney couple claimed to have bought.

title.children: Sydney couple claimed Tasmanian government was 'trespassing' in their house

image.altText: A young man in a black cap and t-shirt smiles with young fans behind him.

props.synopsis: Hobart Hurricanes' Mitch Owen is set for the global stage after a "life-changing" BBL final, say cricketing commentators.

title.children: Mitch Owen 'dished out punishment' and now the cricketing world is on alert

image.altText: DOnald Trump speaks to reporters before boarding Airforce One, January 2025

props.synopsis: A US judge temporarily blocks a Trump administration move to pause federal grants and loans while it conducts an across-the-board ideological review to uproot progressive initiatives.

title.children: US judge temporarily blocks Trump's order to pause federal grants and loans

image.altText: Caroline Kennedy press club

props.synopsis: Caroline Kennedy, the former US ambassador to Australia, has urged US senators to reject her cousin's bid to become health secretary.

title.children: Caroline Kennedy calls RFK Jr a predator ahead of confirmation hearing

image.altText: An older woman with short white hair exercising with a pair of pale blue dumbbells.

props.synopsis: An online program aimed at improving diet, exercise and other modifiable risk factors for dementia has resulted in better cognition in older adults, Australian research has found.

title.children: Major Australian study finds lifestyle changes can delay cognitive decline

image.altText: A woman speaking at a lectern.

props.synopsis: A government frontbencher has encouraged Australians to "be careful" if they download the Chinese-owned AI chatbot DeepSeek. Follow live.

title.children: Government warns Aussies using AI app DeepSeek to 'be careful'

liveBlogKeyEvents.title: Important to be 'upfront and direct' about DeepSeek data concerns: Husic
Aussie AI start up gets $32m boost
Australia's economy has a 'real possibility' of a soft landing, Gallagher says

image.altText: A graphic showing two warships next to each other. One is smaller.

props.synopsis: Tokyo is stepping up its campaign to win a lucrative Australian naval contract by pledging to give "priority" to warship exports over its own navy.

title.children: Japan vows to prioritise Australia over its own navy with new warships

image.altText: US President Donald Trump standing in a door way listening to a question on board an aircraft.

props.synopsis: Donald Trump has ordered a halt to funding gender-affirming care for children across the US.

title.children: Trump orders end to funding for gender-affirming care for children

image.altText: Indian people walk across a small bridge, some carrying belongings and looking scared

props.synopsis: Emergency workers have been pictured ferrying people out of the festival on stretchers after a barrier broke, causing a stampede.

title.children: At least 15 killed in stampede at India's Kumbh Mela festival

image.altText: A female teacher with red hair leans down to the desk of a primary-school student to help her with a question in class.

props.synopsis: Experts warn Australia's education system is "failing to deliver" for half a million kids and putting their future wellbeing at risk, but lessons from 2024 offer hope.

title.children: As Australian students underperform, one group is bucking the trend

image.altText: Mother charged infant

props.synopsis: It's alleged the woman poisoned her daughter and recorded her physical and emotional suffering to elicit donations, and is accused of defrauding donors of $60,000 via crowdfunding.

title.children: Influencer accused of drugging and torturing baby daughter granted bail

image.altText: A blurry image of a woman standing in front of an emergency hospital sign

props.synopsis: With more than half of the state's staff specialist psychiatrists set to resign by the end of the week, health workers say the impacts will reverberate throughout the healthcare system, including already-stressed emergency departments.

title.children: Health workers brace for the worst as psychiatrists across NSW resign

props.synopsis: Around the clock coverage of news events as they break at home and abroad.

title.children: ABC News Channel live

image.altText: A black and white photo of a woman sitting at a table with a book open, looking at the camera.

props.synopsis: A controversial memoir of a Finnish woman who migrated to Stalin’s Soviet Russia in the 1930s and escaped in 1941. Ninety years later, her granddaughter has translated the diary into English.

title.children: Controversial woman's diary became one of Finland's most banned books

image.altText: A woman with dark hair smiles.

props.synopsis: Prominent anti-Voice campaigner Warren Mundine said there was "no doubt" the preselected Liberal candidate for the blue-ribbon Sydney seat of Bradfield was picked because she is a woman.

title.children: Prominent anti-Voice campaigner accused of 'disrespectful' comments

image.altText: A bird's eye view a house with a red roof between two homes with roofs in a lighter colour.

props.synopsis: A body corporate dispute over a red roof has been labelled a "surreal and ludicrous" waste of taxpayer money by Queensland's former body corporate commissioner.

title.children: Legal battle over red roof 'ludicrous' waste of money, says ex-commissioner

image.altText: An outstretched hand wearing a latex glove, holding two test tubes with blood in them.

props.synopsis: The federal government vows to ban life insurers from using genetic testing results to refuse cover or hike premiums, but advocates say delays to the policy are harming patients.

title.children: Impatience grows for promised genetic testing insurance ban

image.altText: A rider dressed in black attempts to hit a bike with a yellow L plate a two other riders ride beside the pair.

props.synopsis: A member of the Mongols bikie gang has been charged over two alleged incidents, including attempting to kick and punch a learner motorcycle rider as they travelled at high speed along a Melbourne freeway, police say.

title.children: Bikie member charged over alleged freeway kick in Melbourne

image.altText: Sandy, greyish ball, being held in a leaf for protection, by a white hand

props.synopsis: An analysis of small grey balls that washed up on Sydney's Northern Beaches earlier this month found they were largely made of soap scum and cosmetics.

title.children: Grey balls found on Sydney beaches made mostly of soap, cosmetics

image.altText: A man stands behind a microphone on a tennis court and looks up left into the stands.

props.synopsis: The protester who shouted at Alexander Zverev after the men's final of the Australian Open has revealed why she decided to make her stand at Melbourne Park.

title.children: 'I hope it happens everywhere': Tennis fan opens up about Zverev protest

image.altText: Sign in a florist saying "dear customer, cash only, no internet"

props.synopsis: For some brands, surviving PR disasters means facing a public backlash and trying to rebuild trust — a nearly impossible task once it's lost.

title.children: PR scandals cost brands millions, so why do some handle it so poorly?

image.altText: A suited arm points to a large sign with a clock at 11.58 and 'It is 2 minutes to Midnight' on it.

props.synopsis: The Doomsday Clock has been reset by scientists to 89 seconds to midnight - closer than ever before to global catastrophe

title.children: Doomsday Clock closer to midnight amid AI emergence and Russian nuclear threat

image.altText: A sunrise with a plane on a stand with figures or children and adults silhouetted

props.synopsis: Residents in Western Australia's Pilbara and Gascoyne regions are set to bear the brunt of a renewed heatwave with challenging conditions expected until next week.

title.children: Temperatures could reach up to 47C in parts of WA battling extreme heat

image.altText: A photo of a fish head with lots of little yellow eggs in its mouth

props.synopsis: Researchers are on edge at the discovery of the tilapia in the Mitchell River after post-cyclone flooding spreads the invasive pest further in Far North Queensland.

title.children: Tilapia found in north Queensland river 'a serious concern'

image.altText: The word 2025 in the shape of a snake on a red background

props.synopsis: How much do you know about the Year of the Snake and unique Lunar New Year traditions in Asian countries? Put your knowledge to the test with these 10 questions and see if you're a true Lunar New Year expert!

title.children: Get to know the upcoming Year of the Snake with 10 questions

image.altText: Man with head torch stands over a large flower

props.synopsis: Hand-pollination of the pungent corpse flower results in hundreds of seeds that will be sent across the world to help preserve the endangered species.

title.children: Adelaide corpse flowers spread endangered stench worldwide

image.altText: Helen poses for a midshot portrait with a gentle smile on her face while wearing a navy jumper, her blonde hair loosely curled.

props.synopsis: Helen Scheuerer could have traditionally published her debut novel, but she decided to self-publish instead. Months later, she quit her day job and never looked back.

title.children: Australian author self-published her way to the bestseller list

image.altText: A plan sits on the tarmac of an airport being doused by water from cranes after catching alight

props.synopsis: The incident comes in the wake of 179 people dying when a plane skidded off a runway at a different airport in the country last month.

title.children: Passenger plane catches fire at South Korean airport

image.altText: an officer and police vehicles on a suburban street

props.synopsis: The Queensland Police Union says officers were "using their bodies as shields" to protect an elderly woman when a man allegedly lunged at them with a large knife.

title.children: First-year cop who shot man three times had 'no other option', union says

image.altText: A man walking while wearing a cap and glasses.

props.synopsis: Christopher Alan Saunders will appear in court next week on six new charges, including one count of sexual penetration of a child under 13.

title.children: Former Broome Bishop accused of raping boy under 13

image.altText: Police & emergency services stand on a bridge surrounding a crash and damaged motorbike, there are police cars in the background

props.synopsis: Police have charged three 14-year-old boys who they caught attempting to run from an allegedly stolen vehicle which fatally collided with a motorcycle during a police chase.

title.children: Teen, 14, to face court after motorcyclist killed during police pursuit
